series.series.name: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- ST. ANTHONY'S INVITATIONAL

abstract.p: Over 1,500 boys and girls from 120 schools take part in St Anthony's High School Invitational track and field meet, South Huntington, NY (M)

block.p: Sean Lambert and Jenn Donovan each won three gold medals yesterday at the St. Anthony's High School Invitational in South Huntington, N.Y. More than 1,500 boys and girls from 120 schools participated in the meet.

Lambert, a senior from Brooklyn's South Shore High, set a meet mark in the boys' 200 meters at 21.3 seconds and took the 100 in 10.81 seconds. He also put his 4x400-meter relay team in first place with a third-leg split of 49.4 seconds as South Shore won in 3 minutes 18.9 seconds.

Sean Lambert and Jenn Donovan each won three gold medals yesterday at the St. Anthony's High School Invitational in South Huntington, N.Y. More than 1,500 boys and girls from 120 schools participated in the meet.

Lambert, a senior from Brooklyn's South Shore High, set a meet mark in the boys' 200 meters at 21.3 seconds and took the 100 in 10.81 seconds. He also put his 4x400-meter relay team in first place with a third-leg split of 49.4 seconds as South Shore won in 3 minutes 18.9 seconds.

Donovan, of Half Hollow Hills, took the girls' 800 meters in 2:16.25 and the 1,500 meters in 4:50.24. She then ran a 61.7-second second-leg split on the Half Hollow 4x400 relay, which finished first in 4:06.77.

Sherian Byam, a junior at Brooklyn's Paul Robeson, also had a standout day. She won the girls' 100-meter dash in 12.53 seconds and the 100 hurdles in 14.3 seconds and finished second in the 200 meters.

Carlos Bedoya, an Archbishop Stepinac senior, beat an outstanding field to win the boys' 400 in 48.18, with Paul Moser of St. Anthony's second in 48.46 and Jamel Myrant of Roosevelt third in 48.80. Damion Drummond, the Paul Robeson sensation of the indoor season, finished fifth in 49.58.
PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- ST. ANTHONY'S INVITATIONAL
